html:
10.26.22  11:17 pm   Why is that thing the way it is and not another way?

      why would it be another way and not this way

10.26.22  11:01 pm   Do you have to be good at drawing to animate?

      no

10.26.22  10:55 pm   what's the right tempo to play giant steps at?

      too fast

10.26.22  10:52 pm   thoughts on grammar

      dank

10.26.22  10:24 pm   can you show us some behind-the-scenes from the recording of the sound effects for "out to lunch"?

      sure

10.26.22  10:23 pm   when you write songs, do you create a skeleton track and then add on the noodly bits after, or more section by section, building the nooodly bits into the track from the start?

      i don't record anything you hear until after the song is written

10.26.22  10:12 pm   Bill, what's your experience with lucid dreaming?

     as soon as i'm aware, it usually ends

     And have you ever had a song come to you in a dream?

     yes

10.26.22  9:50 pm   is it currently a good time to go to lunch? for context i have just currently

      yes

10.26.22  9:16 pm   do you animate your music videos and then record yourself in front of a greenscreen or do you do the greenscreen and then the animation? 

      i usually record a pile of greenscreen footage before doing any graphics. sometimes i do it just for insurance. "the ending" video has a full set of greenscreen footage which wasn't even used

10.26.22  9:12 pm   Can you give us a behind the scenes peek at how you did some of the sound effects in out to lunch?

     sure. i made a checklist of every sound i needed. then i started gathering household objects and tried to get as much as i could from them. then i went through the results and started choosing them and putting them where they go

     Or is it a "magician never reveals his secrets" type of situation?

     not entirely

     Also, did you know going into the video that you didn't want to have a musical score? Or did you finish the voiceover and sound effects and then decided you didn't want any musical cues? 

      if i knew i was doing a music score, i certainly would not have done so much foley. in the past i've used music as a way to escape doing foley. but at some point i realized that this video was a good opportunity to jump into foley because i've really never done it before

10.26.22  8:58 pm   Do you think dogs have an inner monologue?

      yes

10.26.22  8:30 pm   Mr. Wurtz, how many licks does it take to get to the Tootsie Roll center of a Tootsie Pop?

      it doesn't matter, as long as the brand is mentioned, and the question continues to instill curiosity, and therefore remain popular, which in turn generates revenue for the Tootsie Roll company

10.26.22  7:42 pm   how did you make the sound of the juggling bat spinning on the light?

      that's a spinning coin, slowed down. the initial impact of the club is probably something hitting a metal music stand. and the final ping of the club hitting the vertical pole, that's probably something hitting the pole of a speaker stand

10.26.22  7:21 pm   If you ever have made stuff that you're not that happy with, do you ever rip the ideas out of the book or delete the thing you were doing when you know you don't want to keep going on it?

      no

10.26.22  7:01 pm   Are some of your videos based on life experiences? I've noticed that some of the videos (Airport terminal, Long Long Journey, Friends at the Beach, etc.) are all very specific events that you go into detail on. Are these songs based on life experiences,

     no

     and if not, how do you get your inspiration for some of them?

      i'm not sure

10.26.22  6:21 pm   finding any new ways to express yourself yet

      yes

10.26.22  5:11 pm   When is the best time to go out to lunch?

      at the stroke of midnight

10.26.22  4:23 pm   do all of your videos take place in the same universe?

      i doubt it

10.26.22  3:53 pm   can you please use the word "skroingly" in one of your songs? thanks in advance

      i'll look into it

10.26.22  2:16 pm   not to be to greedy my questions are twofold today, one is could you show us the script for the "6+ minute wander/stunt binge" you said you scrapped.

      i have not scrapped anything

10.26.22  1:55 pm   your music videos taste really good to me. do you have a suggestion for how to spread love and hope in the world ?

      whatever ways have worked on you, are worth looking into

10.26.22  1:34 pm   How to be cool?

      there is technically no possible way

10.26.22  1:21 pm   were the clubs ever put back down from up there?

      no. they're still there

10.26.22  11:28 am   What goes through your head when you make music?

     the music

     I've never really heard lyrics like yours so it makes me wonder.

10.26.22  11:24 am   how often do u say "folks"

      sometimes all day

10.26.22  10:46 am   I interpret "out to lunch" as a story about an impulsive man who, alone in this world (no Gina) is quickly distracted by new pursuits (the juggling he's only ever saw before.)
Upon failing this pursuit due to his environment, he quickly associates that part of his life to be tainted, and quickly abandons it. Finally free of the perceived toxicity he just rid his life of, he tries again, feeling confident that a new environment will surely fix the issues, only for a new problem to arise instead. He responds to this by shelving his pursuits for a while and abandoning the environment, but this time planning to return.

Am I overthinking a goofy animation?

      no

10.26.22  8:02 am   is "out to lunch" a story about giving up, or a story about taking a break?

      practicing technique

10.26.22  7:23 am   do you play the trombone ?

      no

10.26.22  7:14 am   Did the person in 'out to lunch' go to the same restaurant as the two from '2 friends on the beach'?

      no

10.26.22  5:37 am   what do you think of the earth

      it's pretty good

10.26.22  5:34 am   Do you think it's important to keep a certain mystery around your art? 

      yes but then change it to a different mystery

10.26.22  4:50 am   my name is Gina and I was sufficiently surprised by the intro of 'out to lunch', was this on purpose

      i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes

10.26.22  4:44 am   I have two things of two different heights, is there a way to get them to be better suited to each other or should I just let them be?

      how about a ramp

10.26.22  3:28 am   given that in "out to lunch" the character is juggling batons,

     i think i disagree with that

     what is your opinion on the sport of juggling candlesticks

     it all depends if they're lit

10.26.22  3:22 am   did you create all the sound effects in "out to lunch"?

      yes

10.26.22  1:32 am   is "Out to Lunch" based on a true story?

      no

10.26.22  1:07 am   the protagonist of "out to lunch" seems considerably skilled at juggling. why does he seem so eager to forget his past when he demonstrates his proficiency so well?

      as i recall, that was after demonstrating some extreme non-proficiency

10.26.22  1:05 am   I thought tuesdays were the day you released songs. Why did you release today's video (non-song) on a tuesday?

      actually the songs are technically released on wednesday. that's because if they're released on tuesday, some people think they're released on monday, due to the time zome difference. but the video is supposed to be released on tuesday

10.25.22  11:57 pm   did you metaphorically go out to lunch or is this another situation where I'm overthinking the situation like many people did when you released "the ending"?

      i actually literally go out to lunch, quite often. but that's not related to the video

10.25.22  11:45 pm   what is your favorite time signature?

      regular

10.25.22  11:08 pm   Can you juggle,

     not so much

     juggling is cool

      i agree

10.25.22  10:57 pm   I'm in a bad mood because of a lot of things can ya help me

      sure

10.25.22  10:33 pm   i noticed a lack of musical underscoring in "out to lunch." i'm very pleasantly surprised. the sound design's great. what was your purpose for this video?

      to work on my character animation skills. secondarily, to work on my foley skills

10.25.22  10:22 pm   did the musician go out 2 1unch so the animator could have more time with tbe computer?

      just about

10.25.22  10:11 pm   where did you obtain / how did you make  the sound effects for the sliding door closing in 'out to lunch'?

     objects from around the house, or sometimes just my hands

      specifically the soft 'thunk' when it finishes closing at 0:23, i find that sound very satisfying.

     that might be an airpods box, probably pitch shifted down

10.25.22  9:27 pm   How did you figure out the model and animation for the sliding door in the most recent video?

      the location of the panels is spaced out linearly, between their start and end points, but the hardest part was figuring out the rotation. according to my reasoning, it needed to be a relationship between the hypotenuse and leg of a right triangle, where the leg grows linearly and the hyponenuse stays constant. so therefore i knew i needed a trigonomic function, so i shopped around and found that acos gave me what i needed. Unfortunately this still isn't really the most authentic result, because the door would have to be spring loaded for it to look like this. What i was originally looking for was something where the first panel moves until it mostly unfolds and then the next panel moves, etc, and i know it's possible to do this but i think it would venture further into calculus than i was ready for at the time

10.25.22  9:24 pm   what is your opinion on the existence (or lack) of ohio

      it does exist

10.25.22  9:22 pm   Hold on bill I'm still thinking of a question to ask 

      ok

10.25.22  9:08 pm   How does the character from 'out for lunch' struggle to juggle the pins and then shortly after land then perfectly on the overhead structure? The landed pins seem to be intentionally thrown based on what the character said. Is the throw intentional or did he land the pins by mistake?

      50/50 between those two scenarios is the sweet spot

10.25.22  8:42 pm   how did you get the sound effects for "out to lunch"?

      from household objects, or sometimes just my hands
